Products.title: Rakshak
Products.desc:
Rakshak an artificial intelligence based predictive maintenance system. Predictive Maintenance service based on the digital application offers user-friendly real-time dashboards and reports with a complete overview of their production assets/equipment’s condition. This platform comprising sensors and data acquisition & transmission unit (Edge/server or cloud based) and data analytics being executed in AI based analytics tool leading to delivery of reports in a customised manner to the client. Complete in-house development with no third party dependency.

In any user site, equipment failure can impact the entire operation and result in costly unplanned downtime.

In addition, remote data collection alleviates the need for manual measurement and inspection of equipment, which often creates unsafe working conditions for user operators. By mitigating inaccurate manual data collection, equipment failure and damage to peripheral equipment can be avoided – and at times the mechanical life of the equipment can even be extended.

By pulling together previously disparate condition data from various assets, such as valves, switches, sensors, motors, switchgear, gearboxes, crushers and conveyors to collectively analyse and compare all data, Ogive is able to provide forewarning of a potential fault with a proposed solution - all with enough time to address it before production is affected.

Currently maintenance being carried out in the following fashion:

  1. Scheduled Maintenance
  2. Preventive maintenance
  3. Breakdown Maintenance
  4. Overhaul

There are four stages to implementing a thorough predictive maintenance strategy using this Ogive service.
  1. During an on-site assessment, Ogive’s experts, together with site maintenance specialists, evaluate the precise maintenance needs.
  2. A long-term solution is then designed based on business goals and technologies available.
  3. In the next stage Ogive’s team deploys the online condition monitoring application.
  4. Finally, Ogive remotely measures and optimises maintenance performance and presents results in periodic reports.
  5. Under a service agreement Ogive ensures the application is always up-to-date so that customer operations, maintenance and automation departments share the same knowledge and can focus on their daily work.
Ogive’s expertise in IoT, AI, data security mechanisms delivers world class solutions and had been successfully deployed across the sectors.

Products.title: Pehchan
Products.desc:
Facial recognition is a way of recognizing a human face through technology. A facial recognition system aided with Artificial Intelligence algorithms maps facial features from a live camera feed or photograph or a video. It compares the information with a database of known faces to find a match.

How PEHCHAAN works.

  • Step 1: A picture of your face is captured from a live camera feed/photo/video. Your face might appear alone or in a crowd. Your image may show you looking straight ahead or nearly in profile.
  • Step 2: Our AI based facial recognition software reads the geometry of your face. Key factors include the distance between eyes and the distance from forehead to chin. The software identifies facial landmarks - one system identifies 68 of them - that are key to distinguishing the face. The result: facial signature.
  • Your facial signature - a mathematical formula - is compared to a database of known faces.
  • A determination is made. your face print may match that of an image in a facial recognition system database.

Facial recognition System integrated with RFID and Biometric system

  1. We have seen the perks of Facial recognition system, in order to make it more secure and robust we have integrated it with RFID/Biometrics.
  2. These systems can be used for verification of employees in an office/police department/to provide authorised access/attendance monitoring/identification
  3. A person has to swipe his card against the reader then image will be fetched from the database and image verification will be done. Similarly the same process can also be performed by replacing RFID reader/tag system with biometric access.

Advantages:

  1. Facial recognition technology provides verification that is authenticated, convenient, quick, and accurate.
  2. Since facial recognition technology is automated, it also reduces the need for security guards to personally verify a match. This means businesses can save costs on hiring security staff and other security measures.
  3. Database could be maintained for records to be accessed as needed
  4. No need to maintain books making this an eco-friendly option
  5. Visitors could be Categorised as required
  6. Can be implemented with existing CCTV infrastructure
  7. Voice, Video & integrated Data Systems

Proposed Applications

  1. Factories entrance and visitors management
  2. Residential areas security and visitor management
  3. Attendance management at offices, schools, college
  4. Advanced ticket or pass for customers in metro or buses
  5. Identification of frequently visiting customers
  6. Homeland security for identification of missing people

Services.title: DIGITAL TWINNING
Services.desc:
Digital twinning, the mapping of a physical asset to a digital platform, is one of the latest technologies to emerge from Industry 4.0. It uses data from sensors on the physical asset to analyse its efficiency, condition and real-time status. Data collected by digital twins are predicting breakages before they happen and reporting them to human operators to save money and time during production. Before the faults occur, businesses can order parts from companies that source automation components, reducing the risk of downtime caused by broken machinery.

The ultimate vision for the digital twin is to create, test and build our equipment/ business in a virtual environment & the physical build tie back to its digital twin through sensors so that the digital twin contains all the information for remote analysis and inspection.

Services.title: IMMERSIVE REALITY
Services.desc:
Virtual Reality (VR) implies a complete immersion experience that shuts out the physical world. Using VR devices such as HTC Vive, Oculus Rift or Google Cardboard, users can be transported into a number of real-world and imagined environments such as the middle of a squawking penguin colony or even the back of a dragon.

Mixed Reality (MR) experience, which combines elements of both AR and VR, real-world and digital objects interact. Mixed reality technology is just now starting to take off with Microsoft’s HoloLens one of the most notable early mixed reality apparatuses.

Extended Reality (XR) is an umbrella term that covers all of the various technologies that enhance our senses, whether they’re providing additional information about the actual world or creating totally unreal, simulated worlds for us to experience. It includes VR, AR & MR technologies. Augmented Reality (AR)adds digital elements to a live view often by using the camera on a smartphone. Examples of augmented reality experiences include Snapchat lenses and the game Pokémon Go
